private_information: Prefers mornings but accepts afternoons if necessary
alice.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on Tuesday, 2025-10-21 when all participants are available.

private_information: Prefers to avoid interruptions to the 10:30-12:00 morning block when possible
bob.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on Tuesday, 2025-10-21 when all participants are available while minimizing interruption to my morning schedule.

private_information: No strong preference between morning and afternoon
carol.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on Tuesday, 2025-10-21 when all participants are available.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver that finds the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 minimizing interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Three colleagues need to schedule a 30-minute meeting on Tuesday, 2025-10-21.
Find the earliest 30-minute time slot when all three are available.
If multiple slots are equally early, prefer the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

availability.system_prompt: You are Alice. Provide your availability for the specified date as a concise structured list of time windows in ISO-like format (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM-HH:MM) and optionally a short preference note. Do not emit PDDL. Only return your availability and any short preference text.

You are Bob. Provide your availability for the specified date as a concise structured list of time windows in ISO-like format (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM-HH:MM) and optionally a short preference note prioritizing minimal interruption to your morning schedule. Do not emit PDDL. Only return your availability and any short preference text.

You are Carol. Provide your availability for the specified date as a concise structured list of time windows in ISO-like format (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM-HH:MM) and optionally a short preference note. Do not emit PDDL. Only return your availability and any short preference text.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the structured availabilities from Alice, Bob, and Carol and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward solver. The PDDL must represent time slots (with the provided granularity), agents, and an objective to find the earliest feasible 30-minute slot that accommodates all participants while minimizing interruption to Bob's morning availability. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct if actions are modeled per agent. Do not assume additional availability beyond what was provided; if information is missing, reflect that in the problem encoding.
